content:
TITLE: Creating a New Dotenv Vault Project
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to create a new project in Dotenv Vault using the CLI. This command initializes the project and sets up the necessary configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest new
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Push Command with dotenv-vault NPX
DESCRIPTION: The primary command to securely push your local .env file to the vault service. This is the first step in the workflow for syncing environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npx dotenv-vault@latest push
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating .env.vault file using dotenv-vault CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command uses the dotenv-vault CLI to build a local .env.vault file. It creates two files: .env.vault (encrypted contents of .env* files) and .env.keys (decryption keys).
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_29

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest local build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Encrypted .env.vault File
DESCRIPTION: Command to generate an encrypted .env.vault file from your environment settings. This file contains all environments' variables in an encrypted format suitable for deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git and Deployment Workflow for .env.vault
DESCRIPTION: Complete workflow for updating the .env.vault file, committing it to version control, and deploying to Heroku. Shows how to manage secrets securely in a deployment pipeline.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ git add .env.vault
$ git commit -am "Update .env.vault"
$ git push
$ git push heroku main # heroku example
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Booting application with .env.vault using DOTENV_KEY
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to start an application using the .env.vault file. It uses the DOTENV_KEY environment variable to provide the decryption key from the .env.keys file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ DOTENV_KEY=<key string from .env.keys> npm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing .env files to dotenv-vault using CLI
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to push .env files securely using the dotenv-vault CLI. It includes examples with different environments, filenames, and flags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest push
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest push production
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest push production .env.production
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest push --dotenvMe=me_b1831e…
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest push -y
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling .env files from dotenv-vault using CLI
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to pull .env files securely using the dotenv-vault CLI. It includes examples for different environments, filenames, flags, and specific versions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest pull
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest pull production
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest pull production .env.production
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest pull --dotenvMe=me_b1831e…
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest pull -y
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx dotenv-vault@latest pull development@v14
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Pull Command with dotenv-vault NPX
DESCRIPTION: The command used to pull the latest environment variables from the vault to your local machine, typically used by team members after someone else has pushed changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npx dotenv-vault@latest pull
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Logging in to dotenv-vault using CLI
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to log in to dotenv-vault using the CLI. It includes examples of using the login command with optional arguments and flags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest login
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest login me_00c7fa…
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest login -y
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Production Decryption Keys
DESCRIPTION: Command to fetch the production environment decryption key, which is needed to decrypt the .env.vault file in production environments. Shows the output format of the key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest keys production
remote:   Listing .env.vault decryption keys... done
dotenv://:key_1234…@dotenv.org/vault/.env.vault?environment=production
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting DOTENV_KEY on Heroku for deployment
DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to set the DOTENV_KEY as a configuration variable on Heroku. This allows the application to decrypt the .env.vault file when deployed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_31

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
$ heroku config:set DOTENV_KEY=<key string from .env.keys>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting DOTENV_KEY on Heroku
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting the DOTENV_KEY environment variable on Heroku. This key allows the application to decrypt the .env.vault file at runtime to access the correct environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# heroku example
heroku config:set DOTENV_KEY=dotenv://:key_1234…@dotenv.org/vault/.env.vault?environment=production
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building .env.vault file using dotenv-vault CLI
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to build the .env.vault file using the dotenv-vault CLI, including examples with flags for non-interactive mode and passing credentials directly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest build
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest build dotenvMe=me_b1831e…
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest build -y
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building .env.vault from local files using dotenv-vault CLI
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to build the .env.vault file from local files only using the dotenv-vault CLI.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest local build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Decrypting .env.vault locally using dotenv-vault CLI
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to decrypt the .env.vault file locally using the dotenv-vault CLI, with an example specifying the DOTENV_KEY.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest local decrypt dotenv://:key_1234@dotenv.local/vault/.env.vault?environment=development
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Decrypting .env.vault locally using dotenv-vault CLI
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to decrypt the .env.vault file locally using the dotenv-vault CLI, with an example specifying the DOTENV_KEY.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest decrypt dotenv://:key_1234@dotenv.org/vault/.env.vault?environment=development
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Workflow for .env.vault Files
DESCRIPTION: Git commands for adding, committing, and pushing the .env.vault file to version control. Unlike .env files which should not be committed, .env.vault files are encrypted and safe to commit.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ git add .env.vault
$ git commit -am "Add .env.vault"
$ git push
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rotating DOTENV_KEY using dotenv-vault CLI
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to rotate the DOTENV_KEY using the dotenv-vault CLI, including examples with flags for passing credentials directly and non-interactive mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest rotatekey production
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest rotatekey dotenvMe=me_b1831e…
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest rotatekey -y
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing .env.vault decryption keys using dotenv-vault CLI
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to list .env.vault decryption keys using the dotenv-vault CLI, with examples for specific environments and flags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_22

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest keys
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest keys production…
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest keys dotenvMe=me_b1831e…
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest keys -y
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing local .env.vault decryption keys using dotenv-vault CLI
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to list local .env.vault decryption keys from the .env.keys file using the dotenv-vault CLI, including an example for a specific environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_28

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest local keys
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest local keys development…
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Dotenv Vault Project with Custom Identifier
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create a new Dotenv Vault project with a custom vault identifier. This allows for more control over the project setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest new vlt_6beaae5…
local:    Adding .env.vault (DOTENV_VAULT)... done
local:    Added to .env.vault (DOTENV_VAULT=vlt_6beaa...)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing dotenv-vault via Homebrew
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing the dotenv-vault CLI using Homebrew package manager on macOS. Shows installation and verifying the installation by accessing the help menu.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ brew install dotenv-org/brew/dotenv-vault
$ dotenv-vault help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running dotenv-vault via Docker
DESCRIPTION: Command to run dotenv-vault using Docker, mapping the current directory into the container to access local files. Shows how to access the help menu via Docker.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ docker run -w $(pwd) -v $(pwd):$(pwd) -it dotenv/dotenv-vault help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Dotenv Vault CLI Help
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to display the help menu for Dotenv Vault CLI, which lists all available commands and their basic usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing version history using dotenv-vault CLI
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to list version history using the dotenv-vault CLI, including examples for specific environments, flags, and pulling a specific version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest versions
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest versions production
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest versions dotenvMe=me_b1831e…
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest versions -y
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx dotenv-vault@latest pull development@v14
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling Production Environment Variables
DESCRIPTION: Command to pull the production environment variables to your local machine. This allows developers to see what variables are set in production for debugging or configuration purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest pull production
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying current user in dotenv-vault using CLI
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to display the current logged-in user using the dotenv-vault CLI, including an example with the dotenvMe flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest whoami
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest whoami dotenvMe=me_b1831e…
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Opening project page in dotenv-vault using CLI
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to open the project page using the dotenv-vault CLI, with examples for different environments and flags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest open
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest open production
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest open -y
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Opening Production Environment in UI
DESCRIPTION: Command to open the production environment settings in the dotenv-vault web UI. This allows for graphical management of environment variables across different environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest open production
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Logging out of dotenv-vault using CLI
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to log out of dotenv-vault using the CLI, including an example with the automatic yes flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest logout
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npx dotenv-vault@latest logout -y
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Console Output for Successful Push
DESCRIPTION: The console output shown after successfully pushing your .env file to the vault service, including the secure building of the .env.vault file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
remote:   Securely pushing (.env)... done
remote:   Securely pushed development (.env)
remote:   Securely built vault (.env.vault)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Local Development Commands with dotenv-vault
DESCRIPTION: Basic commands for local development of dotenv-vault using the bin/dev script. These commands allow you to create new vaults, push changes, and pull updates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
./bin/dev new
./bin/dev push
./bin/dev pull
# etc
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Custom Vault URL for Development
DESCRIPTION: Command to connect to a different vault URL during development, disabling TLS certificate verification and specifying a development API endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0 DOTENV_API_URL=https://vault.dotenv.development ./bin/dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Publishing New Versions to npm
DESCRIPTION: Commands for incrementing the package version and publishing to npm registry. Restricted to users with appropriate permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm version patch
npm publish
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating and Uploading Tarballs for Distribution
DESCRIPTION: Commands for packing, uploading, and promoting tarball packages for distribution. Uses oclif to handle packaging and requires environment variables from a .env file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx oclif@3.0.1 pack tarballs
bash
env $(cat .env | xargs) npx oclif@3.0.1 upload tarballs
env $(cat .env | xargs) npx oclif@3.0.1 promote --version VERSION --sha SHA
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building and Distributing Windows Packages
DESCRIPTION: Commands for creating, uploading, and promoting Windows-specific packages. Uses the local oclif installation and requires environment variables from a .env file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
./node_modules/.bin/oclif pack:win
bash
env $(cat .env | xargs) ./node_modules/.bin/oclif upload win
env $(cat .env | xargs) ./node_modules/.bin/oclif promote --win --version VERSION --sha SHA
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Tests for dotenv-vault
DESCRIPTION: Simple command to execute the test suite for the dotenv-vault project using npm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/DEVELOPMENT.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Dotenv Vault Tests
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install dependencies and run the test suite for the dotenv-vault project. This is a required step before submitting a pull request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
npm test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changelog Entry for Version Changes
DESCRIPTION: A markdown formatted changelog documenting changes across multiple versions of dotenv-vault, including feature additions, modifications, and removals.
SOURCE: https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
### Changed

- Removed use of 'node:fs' and 'node:crypto' that were causing install issues on older versions of node 🧹([#57](https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/pull/57))

## 1.5.1

### Added

- Time out check on `new` and `login` after a couple minutes 🧹([#56](https://github.com/dotenv-org/dotenv-vault/pull/56))
```
